greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of steps to reach 0, starting at n, and iteration the map x -> A261922(x).
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
example: 13 -> 4 -> 3 -> 0, which takes 3 steps to reach 0, so a(13)=3.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Sep 17 2015
